text.p: These are the headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Health care gets C$83 million: Skeptics see Wilson's 'reinvestment' as bid to counter complaints about cuts. - Klein may set pattern for Prime Minister: 'Boring' campaign appears to work.
- Krever offended by federal proposal: Blood prober's letter released.

- Clinton to probe reports of influence-buying: White House, FBI clash over who was told about suspicions of China. - Weary Burmese refugees running out of places to hide: After 48 years of fighting, Karens close to breaking point.
- Paper giants pick Montreal: Abitibi-Price and Stone Consolidated reject Toronto for head office for 'objective' reasons.
- New proposal on gas project causes turmoil: Sable pipeline plan attacked by Nova Scotia.
- Prospectors mine for deals: Seekers of precious minerals and promoters are meeting in Toronto in the annual search for promising handshakes.
- Blended-tax bill hits snag as McKenna, Senate balk.
- Setback for Eaton's suppliers: Desperation mounts as court decisions go against group owed C$150 million by the troubled retail chain.
- International miners home in on Canada.
